required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictors Associated With Seeking Orthodontic Treatment, Compliance and Treatment Success
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Malocclusion Class II/1 - Predictors for Seeking, Compliance and Outcome

brief_summary.textblock:
Aim: to search for reasons for seeking orthodontic treatment, compliance during orthodontic treatment, drop-out from orthodontic treatment and success of orthodontic treatment.
Methods: evaluation before, during and at the end of orthodontic treatment. Clinical and diagnostic evaluation of complexity before and at the end of orthodontic treatment, evaluation of awareness of treatment need, impact on social and psychological aspects, functional disturbances, impact of malocclusion on quality of life, social interaction, ability to perform daily activities.

detailed_description.textblock: Data will include diagnostic measurements on study casts, x-rays, and data from questionnaires given to children and parents. Statistical analyses will explore predictors of treatment success with treatment need, compliance and psycho-social domains.

primary_outcome.description: sagittal distance between upper and lower anterior teeth measured in mm

primary_outcome.measure: Child perception questionnaire age 11-14 (CPQ 11-14 SF16) , subscale measuring oral symptoms
primary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, higher score means greater impact of oral symptoms on quality of life

primary_outcome.measure: subscale functional limitations of CPQ 11-14 SF16
primary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, higher score means greater impact of functional limitations on quality of life

primary_outcome.measure: subscale emotional well-being of CPQ 11-14 SF16
primary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, higher score means greater impact of emotional wee-being on quality of life

primary_outcome.measure: subscale social well-being of CPQ 11-14 SF 16
primary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, higher score means greater impact of social well-being on quality of life
rating scale, answer on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), higher score means greater satisfaction with dental apperance
rating scale, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), higher score means greater self-perceived treatment need

primary_outcome.measure: overall score of CPQ 11-14 SF 16 and SF8
primary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-32 for SF8 and 0-64 for SF16 (sum of all items in short-form 8 and 16 instruments), higher score means higher impact of oral disorders on quality of life

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to one year of appliance wear
primary_outcome.description: sagittal distance between upper and lower anterior teeth measured in mm

secondary_outcome.measure: Parental-Caregiver Perceptions Questionnaire (P CPQ), subscale oral symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: P CPQ, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-24, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on oral symptoms, as perceived by parents / caregivers
P CPQ, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-28, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on functional limitations, as perceived by parents / caregivers
P CPQ, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-32, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on emotional well-being, as perceived by parents / caregivers
P CPQ, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-40, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on social well-being, as perceived by parents / caregivers

P CPQ, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-124 (sum of subscales), higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on quality of life, as perceived by parents / caregivers

secondary_outcome.measure: parental/family activity subscale of Family Impact Scale (FIS) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: FIS questionnaire, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-20, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on parental/family activity, as perceived by parents / caregivers
FIS, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on parental emotions, as perceived by parents / caregivers
FIS, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on family conflict, as perceived by parents / caregivers
FIS, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-4, higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on financial burden, as perceived by parents / caregivers
FIS, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-56 (sum of subscales), higher score means greater impact of children's oral health status on family, as perceived by parents / caregivers

secondary_outcome.measure: change in oral symptoms of CPQ 11-14 SF16
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to one year of appliance wear
secondary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, change in sum score from baseline to one year of appliance, higher score means greater impact of change of oral symptoms on quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: change in functional limitations of CPQ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to one year of appliance wear
secondary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, change in sum score from baseline to one year of appliance, higher score means greater impact of change in functional limitations on quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: change in emotional well-being of CPQ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to one year of appliance wear
secondary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, change in sum score from baseline to one year of appliance, higher score means greater impact of change in emotional well-being on quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: change in social well-being of CPQ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to one year of appliance wear
secondary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-16, change in sum score from baseline to one year of appliance, higher score means greater impact of change in social well-being on quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: change in overall score of CPQ SF8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline to one year of appliance wear
secondary_outcome.description: CPQ 11-14, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-32, change in sum score from baseline to one year of appliance, higher score means greater impact of change in oral disorders on quality of life
16 items and 8 items short form questionnaires, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-64, higher score means greater impairment of quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: validation of P CPQ in Croatia
secondary_outcome.description: 31 items, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-124, higher score means greater impairment of childrens' quality of life perceived by their parents
14 items, answers on 5-point Likert scale (0-4), score range 0-56, higher score means greater impairment of children's' quality of life perceived by their parents

intervention.description: functional appliances for the stimulation of the mandibular growth
functional appliances for the stimulation of the mandibular growth

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- distal molar occlusion, overjet >5 mm, cervical vertebral maturation method stages (CS) -CS2, CS3 or CS4
Exclusion Criteria:
- mental retardation

overall_official.affiliation: University of Rijeka Faculty of Dental Medicine

facility.name: University of Rijeka, Faculty of Dental Medicine

Uhac M, Zibar Belasic T, Perkovic V, Zigante M, Spalj S. Validation of the Parental-Caregivers Perception Questionnaire (P-CPQ) in Croatia. Abstract book 6th Congress of School of Dental Medicine, University of Zagreb. Acta Stomatol Croat. 2020;54:210:212.

Brumini M, Uhac M, Zibar Belasic T, Spalj S. Parental attitude and emotional well-being mediate orthodontic treatment demand in adolescents. Abstract book 6th Congress of School of Dental Medicine, University of Zagreb. Acta Stomatol Croat. 2020;54:210:212-3.
Brumini M. Predictors of orthodontic treatment demand in early adolescence (dissertation). Rijeka; University of Rijeka, Faculty of Medicine: 2020.
